> optim.result
$par
[1] 1.000000e-06 2.500000e+02 1.446460e-03 0.000000e+00 1.000000e-03 1.000000e-03 1.000000e-03
[8] 1.499991e+03

$value
[1] 3.511401e-06

$counts
function gradient 
      73       73 

$convergence
[1] 0

$message
[1] "CONVERGENCE: REL_REDUCTION_OF_F <= FACTR*EPSMCH"


Ok, here's what is going on: By reducing the margin param to near zero, all actual results are pushed to being basically 0.5 within very small bounds. Then the predicted results are matched to be as close to 0.5 as possible, giving as little error in result as possible!

---

-----------------------------------
Harm search back to Elo-style ground adjustments, so different tunable params
Overnight 25-26 Mar 2017

# Tunable parameters
  param.margin <- tunable.params[1]
  
  param.coeff.rating.update <- tunable.params[2]
  param.regress.rating <- tunable.params[3]
  
  param.coeff.ground.update <- tunable.params[4]
  param.regress.ground <- tunable.params[5]

  param.coeff.travel <- tunable.params[6]

  param.rating.expansion.init <- tunable.params[7]

Overnight 26-27 March 2017
Using travel adj = param.coeff.travel * (distance ^ param.power.travel)

  # Tunable parameters
  param.margin <- tunable.params[1]
  
  param.coeff.rating.update <- tunable.params[2]
  param.regress.rating <- tunable.params[3]
  
  param.coeff.ground.update <- tunable.params[4]

  param.power.travel <- tunable.params[6]

  param.rating.expansion.init <- tunable.params[7]

  param.coeff.rating.update <- tunable.params[2]
